question: 選ぶ
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>"choose"</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to choose</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You have the opportunity <vocabulary>to choose</vocabulary>. You choose, and a bright sign lights up reading "<reading>error</reading>" (<ja>えら</ja>).
